a kind of plant.
the plant Oxalis corniculata( = O. pusilla, =Xanthoxalis corniculata) of Oxalidaceae family; Indian sorrel; wood sorrel.
= ಪುಲ್ಲಂಪುರಚಿ.
a man who sells hay, carrying in bundles, for earning his livelihood.

a man who sells flowers and garlands.
= ಪುಲ್ಲವಡಿತಿ.
a woman who sells flowers and garlands.
to become cheerful, merry or lively.
soaked and expanded grains of wheat flour.
a kind of eatable made of this.
a kind of cloth.
(gram.) the masculine gender.
a big leaf (as of a plantain tree) or a platter made of leaves by sewn together, used for taking food.
a covering made by leaves of plants.
a flat, sweet cake made of wheat flour, jaggery, toordal, etc.
an umbrella made using the cloth 'pulli'.
= ಪುಲಿವೆಟ್ಟು.
= ಪುಲಿವೆಟ್ಟು.
any of various plants of the grass family that are usu. used for food, fodder or grazing and as lawns.
(fig.) that which is worthless.

any of the deers, as Muntajacus muntjak, Muntiacus muntjak (var. vaginalis, aureus or malabaricus) of Cervidae family (known as barking deer or rib faced deer) or Axis axis of the same family (popularly known as spotted deer) having bony antlers which they shed periodically.
a very young ox.

a length of rope made of stems of grain after threshing.
the plant Mundulia sericea ( = M. suberosa) of Papilionaceae family.
the small or medium-sized, deciduous tree Salix tetrasperma of Salicaceae family; country willow.
